alert.note: Alert for Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 08 at 6:31PM CDT until May 08 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Harris and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 631 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tomball, Pinehurst, The Woodlands, Spring, Greater Greenspoint, Oak Ridge North, Shenandoah, Stagecoach, Woodloch, Hooks Airport, Splashtown, The Woodlands Pavillion, Chateau Woods, Willowbrook, Porter Heights, northwestern Bush Intercontinental Airport and Cypress. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
